questions.question: What does a red octagonal sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagonal sign is a stop sign.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign mean?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond-shaped sign is a warning sign.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A green traffic light means go if the way is clear.

questions.question: What does a flashing red traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means stop, then proceed when safe.

questions.question: What does a yellow traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A yellow traffic light means slow down and prepare to stop.

questions.question: What does a rectangular white sign with black lettering mean?
questions.explanation: A rectangular white sign with black lettering is a regulation sign.

questions.question: What does a blue traffic sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Blue traffic signs provide information about motorist services.

questions.question: What does a yellow-green traffic sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow-green traffic signs indicate school zones.

questions.question: What does a brown traffic sign indicate?
options: Public recreation and cultural interest area guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Public recreation and cultural interest area guidance
questions.explanation: Brown traffic signs indicate public recreation and cultural interest areas.

questions.question: What does a triangular sign with a red border mean?
questions.explanation: A triangular sign with a red border is a yield sign.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at a four-way stop?
options: The vehicle that is moving fastest
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the vehicle that arrives first has the right-of-way.

questions.question: If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time, who has the right-of-way?
options: The vehicle that is moving fastest
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, if two vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when a vehicle approaches a pedestrian at an intersection with no crosswalks?
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way at intersections.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at a T intersection?
options: The vehicle on the through street
The vehicle on the street that ends
questions.correctAnswer: The vehicle on the through street
questions.explanation: At a T intersection, the vehicle on the through street has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when two vehicles meet on a steep mountain road where neither can pass?
questions.explanation: On a steep mountain road where neither vehicle can pass, the vehicle traveling uphill has the right-of-way.

questions.question: In New Mexico, what is the maximum speed limit on rural interstate highways?
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, the maximum speed limit on rural interstate highways is 75 mph.

questions.question: In New Mexico, what is the speed limit in school zones?
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, the speed limit in school zones is 15 mph.

questions.question: In New Mexico, what is the speed limit in business or residential districts?
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, the speed limit in business or residential districts is 30 mph.

questions.question: When can you legally drive faster than the posted speed limit in New Mexico?
options: When no other vehicles are in sight
questions.explanation: You must always obey the posted speed limit in New Mexico.

questions.question: When should you reduce your speed below the posted limit?
options: When the highway is wet or icy
When there are hazards on the road
questions.explanation: You should reduce your speed below the posted limit when conditions are not ideal.

questions.question: In New Mexico, is it legal to park in a crosswalk?
options: Only if no pedestrians are present
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, it is illegal to park in a crosswalk.

questions.question: In New Mexico, is it legal to park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant?
options: Only if no other parking spaces are available
Only if you stay in the vehicle
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, it is illegal to park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

questions.question: In New Mexico, is it legal to park on a sidewalk?
options: Only if no pedestrians are present
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, it is illegal to park on a sidewalk.

questions.question: In New Mexico, is it legal to park in front of a driveway?
options: Only if no other parking spaces are available
Only if you stay in the vehicle
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, it is illegal to park in front of a driveway.

questions.question: In New Mexico, is it legal to park within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection?
options: Only if no other parking spaces are available
Only if you stay in the vehicle
questions.explanation: In New Mexico, it is illegal to park within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to skid on a wet road?
options: Steer in the direction you want to go
Turn on your high beam headlights
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to skid on a wet road, steer in the direction you want to go.

questions.question: What should you do if your headlights fail suddenly while driving at night?
options: Continue driving using your parking lights
Turn on your hazard lights and pull over as soon as possible
questions.correctAnswer: Turn on your hazard lights and pull over as soon as possible
questions.explanation: If your headlights fail suddenly while driving at night, turn on your hazard lights and pull over as soon as possible.

questions.question: What should you do if a tire blows out while you are driving?
options: Steer straight and slow down gradually
Turn on your high beam headlights
questions.correctAnswer: Steer straight and slow down gradually
questions.explanation: If a tire blows out while you are driving, steer straight and slow down gradually.

questions.question: What should you do if you are caught in a dust storm and can't see the road?
options: Continue driving at a slow speed
Pull over, turn off your lights, and wait until visibility improves
Turn on your high beam headlights
Accelerate out of the dust storm
questions.correctAnswer: Pull over, turn off your lights, and wait until visibility improves
questions.explanation: If you are caught in a dust storm and can't see the road, pull over, turn off your lights, and wait until visibility improves.

questions.question: What should you do if your brakes fail while driving?
options: Switch to a lower gear and look for a place to slow down and stop
questions.explanation: If your brakes fail while driving, pump the brake pedal rapidly, switch to a lower gear, and look for a place to slow down and stop.
